DataElement.preferredName: Post Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation Therapeutic Procedure Plan Administration Yes No Character Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the administration of additional post-hematopoietic cell transplantation therapy was planned.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Post Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation Therapeutic Procedure Plan Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_The grafting of tissues from one individual to another or place to place within a single individual._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._To devise, contrive, or formed in design._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Post Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Therapeutic Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):The grafting of tissues from one individual to another or place to place within a single individual.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: Planned; devised, contrived, or formed in design.:The act of administration.

Concepts.definition: To devise, contrive, or form in design.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping path for CDE:2738491
ReferenceDocuments.description: "PerformedProcedure [post-HCT therapy] > DefinedProcedure.nameCode(CD).code OR DefinedProcedure.nameCode(CD).originalText WHERE DeffinedProcedure.nameCode = {administer specified therapy} AND DefinedProcedure [post-HCT therapy] > DefinedCompositeRelationship [1] > DefinedActivity.nameCode = ""Perform Overall Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation""  [overall HCT process] > DefinedCompositeRelationship [2] > DefinedSubstanceAdministration.nameCode = ""Administer Hematopoietic Stem Cell Product {Transplantation}"" AND DefinedCompositeRelationship.sequenceNumber [1] IS GREATER THAN DefinedCompositionRelationship.sequenceNumber [2] AND PerformedProcedure.negationIndicator(BL).value = ""false"" [Yes] OR ""true"" [No] "

DataElement.changeDescription: . Added human readable def. System generated def displayed as alt def. No version needed. AK10/16/14
